name: Ruby - Rails Integration
description: Sentry configuration for Rails applications with automatic request tracking
useCase: Rails web applications with performance monitoring
seGuidance: Recommended for all Rails customers. The Rails integration automatically captures request context, user info, and Active Record queries. Performance monitoring helps identify slow database queries and controller actions. Add sentry-rails gem to your Gemfile.
configCode:
# config/initializers/sentry.rb

Sentry.init do |config|
  config.dsn = ENV['SENTRY_DSN']
  
  # Environment from Rails config
  config.environment = Rails.env
  
  # Release version
  config.release = ENV.fetch('SENTRY_RELEASE', '1.0.0')
  
  # Performance monitoring
  config.traces_sample_rate = 0.1
  
  # Capture user context (requires helper)
  config.send_default_pii = false
  
  # Breadcrumb limit
  config.max_breadcrumbs = 50
  
  # Only report errors from these environments
  config.enabled_environments = %w[production staging]
  
  # Exclude common Rails exceptions
  config.excluded_exceptions += [
    'ActionController::RoutingError',
    'ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound'
  ]
end
